meanings.definition: Arrogant or conceited in a bold or impudent way.
meanings.sent1: She always acts coky and thinks she is better than everyone else.
meanings.sent2: His coky behavior often rubs people the wrong way.
meanings.sent3: Despite his coky attitude, he couldn't even solve a simple math problem.
meanings.sent4: Her coky demeanor was like a bright neon sign demanding attention.
meanings.sent5: The coky cat strutted around the neighborhood as if it owned the place.

meanings.definition: Showing a self-assured or cocksure attitude.
meanings.sent1: The coky student confidently raised his hand to answer the question.
meanings.sent2: His coky smile revealed his certainty in his own abilities.
meanings.sent3: Even though he was lost, his coky demeanor never wavered.
meanings.sent4: Her coky attitude was a shield against any self-doubt.
meanings.sent5: The coky squirrel fearlessly approached the picnic blanket for a snack.

meanings.sent1: The coky salesperson insisted that their product was the best on the market.
meanings.sent2: Her coky remarks offended some of the more reserved guests.
meanings.sent3: Despite his coky behavior, he was surprisingly shy around new people.
meanings.sent4: The coky bird swooped down to steal a fry from the unsuspecting picnic-goer.
meanings.sent5: His coky attitude in the face of danger impressed his companions.
